<td style="padding-top:20px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good Friday morning. </strong>In his annual “personal challenge” post yesterday, Mark Zuckerberg discussed the dominant technology platforms of previous decades: The 1990s belonged to the desktop computer, the 2000s the web, and the 2010s the mobile phone.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Sometime in the 2020s, Zuck predicts, augmented reality glasses will redefine our relationship with technology. Is he right?</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
JOBS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/09/economists-workers-labor-market-red-hot?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Book of Jobs
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="A gif of a desk, chair, and computer coming together" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=447 src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1578602486.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="A gif of a desk, chair, and computer coming together" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1578602486.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Did anything have a better 2019 than the Instagram egg? Quite possibly the red hot U.S. labor market, which earned the applause of Fed chairs and minimum wage workers alike. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Today is the grand finale: </strong>the big December jobs report. Economists predict the U.S. economy added <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-01-09/a-great-year-for-u-s-jobs-is-also-likely-to-be-worst-since-2011?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">160,000 new jobs</a> last month. If that’s the case (and we’ll find out at 8:30am ET) then job gains in 2019 will total 2.14 million—an impressive figure for any year, let alone one that’s the eleventh in an economic expansion. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>As of November, the U.S. economy had been adding jobs for 110 straight months.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>At 3.5%, the unemployment rate is its lowest since 1969. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">So are workers feeling the benefits? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It seems like it.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Taco Bell said it’ll pay the general managers of some company-owned restaurants a salary of $100,000 in a <a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/taco-bell-will-run-pilot-program-paying-select-managers-100000-a-year-but-in-n-out-burger-already-pays-managers-160000-2020-01-09?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pilot program</a> starting later this year. That position pays $50,000–$80,000 currently. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Income is rising for minimum wage workers, too. More than 20 states <a href="https://www.npr.org/2020/01/09/794280616/minimum-wage-hikes-fuel-higher-pay-growth-for-those-at-the-bottom?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">raised their minimum wage</a> on Jan. 1, pushing the effective average minimum wage to nearly $12/hour. And that’s contributed to an interesting economic trend: Wage growth for the lowest American earners is now <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/03/upshot/minimum-wage-boost-bottom-earners.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">topping</a> that for high-earners by the most in two decades.<strong style="color:#000"></strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">More good news: </strong></span><span>49% of U.S. workers said they received a pay bump in 2019, according to a </span><span><a href="https://www.bankrate.com/surveys/financial-security-poll-december-2019/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Bankrate survey</a></span><span>, up from 38% a year earlier. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Let’s puncture the balloon a bit</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If projections come true for 2019, job growth will still be its slowest since 2011. That’s because a) we’re 11 years into an economic expansion b) the 5-hour energy from tax cuts has worn off and c) the trade war is still crimping the economy. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ End with a bang: </strong>Google received <a href="https://www.axios.com/google-2019-applications-backlash-972203e4-8e86-4cec-aa26-195572c69e13.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">3.3 million job applications</a> last year, per Axios, an 18% increase from 2018. </p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AVIATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/09/boeing-caught-another-disaster?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Boeing Caught Up in Another Disaster
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Boeing 737" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MjA4L2JvZWluZ183MzcuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>tjdarmstadt, Ukraine International Airlines Boeing 737-800 (UR-PSF) at Frankfurt Airport (2), CC BY 2.0</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">When incoming Boeing CEO David Calhoun starts work next Monday, <a href="https://apnews.com/a1a4581bc0d919fc1e09a93d988263be?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">first on his to-do list</a> will be to handle the fallout from the international disaster that left 176 people dead. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What happened: </strong>A Ukraine International Airlines Boeing 737—an earlier model than the grounded 737 Max—crashed outside Tehran on Wednesday. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The key question is whether the plane was attacked or malfunctioned. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>U.S. officials </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/boeing-jet-was-on-fire-before-crash-iran-says-11578558346?mod=business_lead_pos6&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">believe</a></span><span> Iranian forces shot the plane down. Tensions between the two countries are at their highest in recent memory after a U.S. airstrike killed a top Iranian general, and Iran retaliated with strikes of its own.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau </span><span><a href="https://www.axios.com/iran-plane-crash-ukrainian-investigation-missile-strike-9a38ce58-1d07-4ea7-9ac5-eb15a4d8983c.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a></span><span> evidence points to Iran shooting down the plane. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Iran said there was a technical issue and denied any attack. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">An investigation is underway—but it’s out of Boeing’s hands. Ukraine and Iran will work together, despite International Civil Aviation Organization rules that give plane makers a right to be involved in crash probes. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>This issue is separate from Boeing’s 737 Max woes, which center on a flight-control system the earlier 737 didn’t have. The company’s stock <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-01-09/iran-says-boeing-jet-tried-to-turn-back-before-crashing?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">closed</a> 1.5% higher yesterday.</p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TRANSPORTATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/09/lime-makes-cuts-seeks-profitability?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Lime Puts on the Profitability Helmet
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Lime scooters" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc4NjA0MDcxLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Lime</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Dry January already took your tequila, but yesterday it came for the Limes. The scooter company <a href="http://v1.li.me/second-street/the-path-forward-at-lime?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a> it’s powering down in 12 markets around the world, including Phoenix, Atlanta, San Diego, and San Antonio, while it focuses on profitability.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Lime will </span><span><a href="https://www.axios.com/e-scooter-startup-lime-shuts-in-12-markets-lays-off-around-100-d25d44e4-c0f1-4713-9a89-868f4da40e03.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">lay off</a></span><span> around 100 employees (~14% of its workforce), according to Axios. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The news comes three months after The Information </span><span><a href="https://www.theinformation.com/articles/limes-loss-to-top-300-million-in-2019?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reported</a></span><span> Lime’s 2019 losses will exceed $300 million on more than $420 million in revenue. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Lime’s not alone.</strong> Scooter operations require lots of capital, and after years of expanding in domestic and international markets, most major players have made cuts while pursuing profitability. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Lime President Joe Kraus told Axios he expects Lime to be profitable this year, thanks in part to more durable scooter models. Last month, Lime also <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2019/12/18/lime-rolls-subscription-service?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">unveiled</a> a subscription service targeted at commuters, who account for over half its riders.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Have we mentioned it’s CES week? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Other micromobility companies are vying for page space. Chinese startup NIU will <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/1/6/21051352/china-niu-electric-scooters-mopeds-ces-2020?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sell</a> its electric mopeds in the U.S. And Segway-Ninebot debuted a <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/1/3/21047576/segway-ninebot-escooter-air-t15-t60-ces-2020?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">scooter with cruise control</a> and...<a href="https://www.cnet.com/news/segways-wall-e-egg-chair-made-me-feel-like-royalty/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">this thing</a>. </p>

<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Snakes chasing iguana " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/x9z3LgB3drx6M/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">During our lunch run to the Wall Street Cava yesterday, we noticed our Ferragamo-shod neighbors furiously Googling “next amazon.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The reason? Investors did their own Decade in Review (ours is still available <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/decade-in-review?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">here</a>) and the overwhelming message of the 2010s was to scoop up all the huge tech stocks they could find, especially those named after snake teeth—the FAANG index. That stands for Facebook, Amazon, Apple, Netflix, and Google. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Tech is easily the biggest sector in the U.S. stock market, accounting for over 25% of its value. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>FAAMG (FAANG minus Netflix plus Microsoft) has added a total of $4.3 trillion in market cap, </span><span><a href="https://www.ft.com/content/3b869d6e-314c-11ea-9703-eea0cae3f0de?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">per the FT,</a></span><span> which is more than the U.K. stock market’s value. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But with the original FAANG stocks sprouting gray hair, the question facing Wall Street is...who’s next to join the club? Tesla? Alibaba? Salesforce? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">One differentiator could be sustainability. A Goldman Sachs chief strategist told the FT that companies working on decarbonization will be more attractive to investors this decade. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Your turn: </strong>Which company will be the next to join FAANG? <a href="https://twitter.com/MorningBrew/status/1215399762410733573?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Join the conversation here</a>. </p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
QUIZ
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/09/brews-weekly-news-quiz-january-10?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Quizchella
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<img alt="Coachella Ferris wheel " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc4NjA0Njc4LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Pxhere</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Marginally better dance moves than Elon Musk. Quitting the Royal Family. <a href="https://www.instagram.com/morningbrew/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Back on Insta</a>. It’s the Brew’s Weekly News Quiz. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">1. Yum Brands, the owner of KFC, Pizza Hut, and Taco Bell, <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/06/yum-brands-wades-fast-casual?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">is acquiring</a> which burger chain?</p>
<ol style="list-style-type: lower-alpha;">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In-N-Out Burger</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Habit Burger Grill</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Whataburger</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Five Guys</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Good Burger </span></li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">2. <strong style="color:#000">Fill in the blanks: </strong>Gold is considered a “____ ____” asset, meaning it <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/06/investors-pile-gold-amid-usiran-tensions?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">isn’t correlated </a>to broader stock movements. Investors often seek these out during tense geopolitical episodes. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">3. The Philadelphia Fed predicted that nine states’ economies <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/05/philadelphia-fed-projects-nine-states-will-enter-contraction?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">will shrink</a> in the next six months. <strong style="color:#000">Name as many as you can. </strong>(100 points each, 1.5 points for all nine.)</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Here’s a hint for ornithologists. </span><span><a href="https://www.50states.com/bird/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Their state birds</a></span><span> are the Hermit Thrush, Eastern Goldfinch, Cardinal, Robin, Blue Hen Chicken, Western Meadowlark, Scissor-tailed Flycatcher, Cardinal (again), and Ruffed Grouse. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">4. More than 10,000 Disney superfans applied to be a part of the Disney Parks Moms Panel. What will the 14 who were selected be paid <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/08/disney-selects-14-join-parks-moms-panel?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">exactly $0</a> to do? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">5. He’s an <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/08/carlos-ghosn-speaks-first-time-since-escape?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">international fugitive</a>, former auto industry titan, and, presumably, not at all claustrophobic. <strong style="color:#000">What’s his name? </strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><sup class="sub-text"><em><strong style="color:#000">Answers: </strong>1. Habit Burger Grill 2. Safe haven 3. Vermont, New Jersey, Kentucky, Connecticut, Delaware, Montana, Oklahoma, West Virginia, and Pennsylvania, 4. Answer <span>online questions about Disney parks and cruises</span> 5. Carlos Ghosn</em></sup></p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Dear retail pros, </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Did you know we have a retail-focused newsletter?</strong> It’s called Retail Brew, and it’s written twice a week by the brilliant and witty Halie LeSavage. In the most recent edition, she covered: Pier 1’s slow decline, how the American Dream mall is beating the odds, and SmileDirectClub’s retail savior. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The next edition is hitting inboxes in just a few hours...what'll be inside? <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/retail/?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=retailbrew&email={email}" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Sign up to find out</a>. </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><span>Take the given word pairs, and by moving a single letter from one word to the other, make a pair of synonyms, or near-synonyms. </span></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Ex. </strong>Boast - Hip, move the "s" from "Boast" to "Hip" to create "Boat" and "Ship."<br><br>1. Inks - Tiles<br>2. Ride - Relive<br>3. Gaze - Freed<br>4. Snail - Pike<br>5. Snag - Cold</p>

style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDid anything have a better 2019 than the Instagram egg? Quite possibly the red hot U.S. labor market, which earned the applause of Fed chairs and minimum wage workers alike. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eToday is the grand finale: \u003c/strong\u003ethe big December jobs report. Economists predict the U.S. economy added \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-01-09/a-great-year-for-u-s-jobs-is-also-likely-to-be-worst-since-2011?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e160,000 new jobs\u003c/a\u003e last month. If that’s the case (and we’ll find out at 8:30am ET) then job gains in 2019 will total 2.14 million—an impressive figure for any year, let alone one that’s the eleventh in an economic expansion. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAs of November, the U.S. economy had been adding jobs for 110 straight months.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAt 3.5%, the unemployment rate is its lowest since 1969. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSo are workers feeling the benefits? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt seems like it.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, Taco Bell said it’ll pay the general managers of some company-owned restaurants a salary of $100,000 in a \u003ca href=\"https://www.marketwatch.com/story/taco-bell-will-run-pilot-program-paying-select-managers-100000-a-year-but-in-n-out-burger-already-pays-managers-160000-2020-01-09?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epilot program\u003c/a\u003e starting later this year. That position pays $50,000–$80,000 currently. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIncome is rising for minimum wage workers, too. More than 20 states \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2020/01/09/794280616/minimum-wage-hikes-fuel-higher-pay-growth-for-those-at-the-bottom?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eraised their minimum wage\u003c/a\u003e on Jan. 1, pushing the effective average minimum wage to nearly $12/hour. And that’s contributed to an interesting economic trend: Wage growth for the lowest American earners is now \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/03/upshot/minimum-wage-boost-bottom-earners.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etopping\u003c/a\u003e that for high-earners by the most in two decades.\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMore good news: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e49% of U.S. workers said they received a pay bump in 2019, according to a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bankrate.com/surveys/financial-security-poll-december-2019/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eBankrate survey\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, up from 38% a year earlier. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eLet’s puncture the balloon a bit\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf projections come true for 2019, job growth will still be its slowest since 2011. That’s because a) we’re 11 years into an economic expansion b) the 5-hour energy from tax cuts has worn off and c) the trade war is still crimping the economy. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ End with a bang: \u003c/strong\u003eGoogle received \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/google-2019-applications-backlash-972203e4-8e86-4cec-aa26-195572c69e13.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e3.3 million job applications\u003c/a\u003e last year, per Axios, an 18% increase from 2018. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MjA4L2JvZWluZ183MzcuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003etjdarmstadt, Ukraine International Airlines Boeing 737-800 (UR-PSF) at Frankfurt Airport (2), CC BY 2.0\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhen incoming Boeing CEO David Calhoun starts work next Monday, \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/a1a4581bc0d919fc1e09a93d988263be?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efirst on his to-do list\u003c/a\u003e will be to handle the fallout from the international disaster that left 176 people dead. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat happened: \u003c/strong\u003eA Ukraine International Airlines Boeing 737—an earlier model than the grounded 737 Max—crashed outside Tehran on Wednesday. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe key question is whether the plane was attacked or malfunctioned. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eU.S. officials \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/boeing-jet-was-on-fire-before-crash-iran-says-11578558346?mod=business_lead_pos6\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebelieve\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Iranian forces shot the plane down. Tensions between the two countries are at their highest in recent memory after a U.S. airstrike killed a top Iranian general, and Iran retaliated with strikes of its own.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eCanadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/iran-plane-crash-ukrainian-investigation-missile-strike-9a38ce58-1d07-4ea7-9ac5-eb15a4d8983c.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e evidence points to Iran shooting down the plane. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIran said there was a technical issue and denied any attack. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAn investigation is underway—but it’s out of Boeing’s hands. Ukraine and Iran will work together, despite International Civil Aviation Organization rules that give plane makers a right to be involved in crash probes. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eThis issue is separate from Boeing’s 737 Max woes, which center on a flight-control system the earlier 737 didn’t have. width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDuring our lunch run to the Wall Street Cava yesterday, we noticed our Ferragamo-shod neighbors furiously Googling “next amazon.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe reason? Investors did their own Decade in Review (ours is still available \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/decade-in-review?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehere\u003c/a\u003e) and the overwhelming message of the 2010s was to scoop up all the huge tech stocks they could find, especially those named after snake teeth—the FAANG index. That stands for Facebook, Amazon, Apple, Netflix, and Google. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTech is easily the biggest sector in the U.S. stock market, accounting for over 25% of its value. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eFAAMG (FAANG minus Netflix plus Microsoft) has added a total of $4.3 trillion in market cap, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/3b869d6e-314c-11ea-9703-eea0cae3f0de?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eper the FT,\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e which is more than the U.K. stock market’s value. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut with the original FAANG stocks sprouting gray hair, the question facing Wall Street is...who’s next to join the club? Tesla? Alibaba? Salesforce? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOne differentiator could be sustainability. A Goldman Sachs chief strategist told the FT that companies working on decarbonization will be more attractive to investors this decade. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eYour turn: \u003c/strong\u003eWhich company will be the next to join FAANG? \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/MorningBrew/status/1215399762410733573?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eJoin the conversation here\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F01%2F09%2Fcompany-set-join-faang-gang\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; Quitting the Royal Family. \u003ca href=\"https://www.instagram.com/morningbrew/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eBack on Insta\u003c/a\u003e. Yum Brands, the owner of KFC, Pizza Hut, and Taco Bell, \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/06/yum-brands-wades-fast-casual?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eis acquiring\u003c/a\u003e which burger chain?\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003col style=\"list-style-type: lower-alpha;\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn-N-Out Burger\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHabit Burger Grill\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWhataburger\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFive Guys\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eGood Burger \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ol\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e2. \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFill in the blanks: \u003c/strong\u003eGold is considered a “____ ____” asset, meaning it \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/06/investors-pile-gold-amid-usiran-tensions?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eisn’t correlated \u003c/a\u003eto broader stock movements. Investors often seek these out during tense geopolitical episodes. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e3. The Philadelphia Fed predicted that nine states’ economies \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/05/philadelphia-fed-projects-nine-states-will-enter-contraction?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewill shrink\u003c/a\u003e in the next six months. \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eName as many as you can. \u003c/strong\u003e(100 points each, 1.5 points for all nine.)\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eHere’s a hint for ornithologists. \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.50states.com/bird/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eTheir state birds\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e are the Hermit Thrush, Eastern Goldfinch, Cardinal, Robin, Blue Hen Chicken, Western Meadowlark, Scissor-tailed Flycatcher, Cardinal (again), and Ruffed Grouse. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e4.
